intro: Lotoxalis manihotoides, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range from white to pink in color. It is cultivated for its starchy roots, which are used as a food source. Due to its adaptability, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
